page.title: 20EMPLOYMENT IN BENINGTON
page.content:
About 70% of the working population go out of Benington for work. Many go to the nearby newtown of Stevenage. Of those employed in the village about 100 are employed at Bracey's, making farm machinery,and others are on farms, at the riding stables, at the shop, and at two public houses, etc. 40 people are unemployed. Finding work is equally difficult for both older and younger people.
SURVEY UNDERTAKEN by D.Allen,N.Bannist- er,E.Bird,K.Bloxham,L.Bull,N.Bull,L. Burgess,T.Erskine,R.Gomm,K.Hanlon,S. Harris,C.Janata,K.Patterson,R.Symons,S. Taylor,L.Terrett,P.Tisdall,C.Turner,K. Woo,M.Barry,S.Burgess,N.Collier,S.Craw- ford,P.Mariner,M.Parish,P.Retallick,R. Saville,D.Sherwood,R.Thaw,S.Wood,J. Croft,M.Davies,D.Elmes,N.Gledhill.
